notes:
Weapon power (WP) and Attack speed (AttkSpd) both increase Mercy's healing. A balanced ratio of both is theoretically best, but you'll generally focus on the combined value of both. 
 [First Aid Kit](item_0172eaaa-1902-44a3-b989-d12f0f7301da) is pretty much interchangeable with  [Armored Vest](item_358361e2-59be-4c81-b221-8a87f37809e6).  [First Aid Kit](item_0172eaaa-1902-44a3-b989-d12f0f7301da) is better on longer range maps and against slower teams. [Armored Vest](item_358361e2-59be-4c81-b221-8a87f37809e6) is better if the enemy plays fast or targets you with chip damage.

Running  [Crepuscular Circle](item_c0b93ed2-b692-44d5-a38a-ce5a63e83cdb)  first round is typically pretty bad. Even though Crep Circle does help farm cash and win battles,  [Threads of Fate](item_cb61612b-9d83-49a9-989d-013bf084fbcb) is more consistent value with increased healing and DMG boost throughout the round. Moreover,  [Threads of Fate](item_cb61612b-9d83-49a9-989d-013bf084fbcb) will pair well with  [Crepuscular Circle](item_c0b93ed2-b692-44d5-a38a-ce5a63e83cdb) because  [Threads of Fate](item_cb61612b-9d83-49a9-989d-013bf084fbcb) helps you build Valk, something that most other powers don't do. 

 [The Whambulance](item_67e91029-d0fc-4c9d-9733-ec7e1cc064a9) is for Ability Power (AP) Mercy builds. It's best round 1 where it can help you push DMG boost (use the power to heal while still DMG boosting).  [The Whambulance](item_67e91029-d0fc-4c9d-9733-ec7e1cc064a9) can technically be good for pocketing, and, at the extreme late game (Rounds 5-7) it can actually outscale normal builds in single-target healing. This issue with this power is how vulnerable it is to hitscan. If you aren't spamming Guardian Angel (GA) a lot, then  [Threads of Fate](item_cb61612b-9d83-49a9-989d-013bf084fbcb) will just be significantly better overall. 

Shorthand: (AP mercy is playable but not strong or meta)

round_upgrades.notes: Overall better because of the 33% faster Regen passive. With how evasive Mercy is,the Regen will actually help!

It's not recommended to get Crep Circle first. Threads of Fate helps farm ult charge, so you'll probably want to get it later anyway. Threads of Fate is also better overall in the early game (as a stand-alone power)
For Ability Power (AP) Mercy. There's simply not enough space for me to talk about this. I also don't play AP Mercy o-o I'm just aware that it exists as an off-meta option
Better against speedy teams with Juno, Lucio, or Genji. Also ~better on more open/short ranged maps.

notes:
Selling  [Aftermarket Firing Pin](item_2485b212-b286-42d0-a2bd-20eb4396b054) ,  [First Aid Kit](item_0172eaaa-1902-44a3-b989-d12f0f7301da) , and  [Armored Vest](item_358361e2-59be-4c81-b221-8a87f37809e6) can allow you to buy  [Talon Modification Module](item_c0ca1795-a3ea-4dc9-ae17-f34122574b3a). 25 shield hp + 25 armor + 10% AttkSpd is overall more value compared to  [Talon Modification Module](item_c0ca1795-a3ea-4dc9-ae17-f34122574b3a), but the extra healing can be impactful and help earn cash. Ultimately, this is up to preference.

If you don't have enough to buy both  [First Aid Kit](item_0172eaaa-1902-44a3-b989-d12f0f7301da) and  [Armored Vest](item_358361e2-59be-4c81-b221-8a87f37809e6), consider buying  [Running Shoes](item_950eccea-31a0-4a55-8c2a-for5bf7920e1aa)  or  [Charged Plating](item_b8ca58e7-6ae2-40ee-8618-fe2f32315295). Please read the notes for further info.

I'd also like to mention that [Chain Evoker](item_812cc89e-feb0-47d0-9e03-9d8e33a80aca) is a viable option for Round 2. It's just that the combination of WP and AttkSpd is easier to use and is situationally better with a dps support/Lucio (like WP stack Clone Kiriko or Juno's torpedo/blink boots dps build). [Chain Evoker](item_812cc89e-feb0-47d0-9e03-9d8e33a80aca) is harder to use when you don't have a particular player or two popping off consistently.

round_upgrades.notes: This is the highest value blue item for Mercy's healing . It's actually marginally better than 15%WP
Use this to maximize value on a budget. This item is only good on longer maps.
The passive isn't all that useful for Mercy. Just like armored plating, this maximizes an extra 1K

notes:
[Crepuscular Circle](item_c0b93ed2-b692-44d5-a38a-ce5a63e83cdb) is by far the Round 3 choice. By Round 3 you need to be prepared to carry your team out of a 0-3 situation or a 0-4 on Round 4.  [Crepuscular Circle](item_c0b93ed2-b692-44d5-a38a-ce5a63e83cdb) is amazing even without pulling out the blaster (although it is advised).  [Crepuscular Circle](item_c0b93ed2-b692-44d5-a38a-ce5a63e83cdb) is way more flexible and impactful compared to even Juno's orbital ray (crep circle also charges faster). 
To put it simply, Crep Circle farms cash and win teamfights.

 [Chain Evoker](item_812cc89e-feb0-47d0-9e03-9d8e33a80aca)  is essential. Unless your team is taking a lot of damage without a fight,  [Chain Evoker](item_812cc89e-feb0-47d0-9e03-9d8e33a80aca) gives the hugest advantage to you and your team. 

From now on you need to search for key abilities and angles to damage boost. Now that dmg boost is 35% and the ultimate charge gained is increased, it becomes an important balance between impactful dmg boost and pretty much heal botting.

Alternatively, you can try to stack WP and AttckSpd; in which case you should try to buy  [Amari's Antidote](item_67e0b1c5-3bcb-4ab5-b818-5082e5706124). If needed, you can also buy armor items. I like to combine  [Armored Vest](item_358361e2-59be-4c81-b221-8a87f37809e6) and  [First Aid Kit](item_0172eaaa-1902-44a3-b989-d12f0f7301da), but  [Vital-E-Tee](item_b92e6f1d-3aac-4eec-b027-00c8e1529016) is similar and often better (just watch out for Damage heroes using  [Codebreaker](item_caa96c7e-655f-4d03-9bd9-0f41937fec27) to ignore your armor.

Get [Amari's Antidote](item_67e0b1c5-3bcb-4ab5-b818-5082e5706124) for clutch healing on critical allies (plus some more hp). Remember that a good ratio of AttkSpd and WP leads to more healing; bcs of that I usually sell off [Talon Modification Module](item_c0ca1795-a3ea-4dc9-ae17-f34122574b3a) to get  [Amari's Antidote](item_67e0b1c5-3bcb-4ab5-b818-5082e5706124) and then stack AttkSpd with [Aftermarket Firing Pin](item_2485b212-b286-42d0-a2bd-20eb4396b054) and [Advanced Nanobiotics](item_26fcf7c9-b81a-4d8e-a459-b515519cb73e).
Feel free to replace either of the 5% WP or AttkSpd with 25 shield hp or 25 armor if it maximizes cash and you want the survivability.

round_upgrades.notes: Sometimes, in a hopeless match I'll choose this over Chain Evoker just to stay alive and heal more in cases where there's almost no time to DMG boost (tbh you typically lose theoe games but ya'know it's good to try)

notes:
Whew! Now we finally have free will with our Power choice! But first I should just get it out of the way that [Booster Jets](item_a291de85-b6d9-43cf-b5da-f3184a156f48) will lead to the biggest increase in healing at this point, especially If you're looking to replace [Aftermarket Firing Pin](item_2485b212-b286-42d0-a2bd-20eb4396b054) and/or [Advanced Nanobiotics](item_26fcf7c9-b81a-4d8e-a459-b515519cb73e) for survivability/utility.

[Distortion](item_5557e2f2-02df-4eac-8128-0c23b71183b1) is my go-to option because it helps allies sustain, even when using DMG boost, and doesn't require resurrect to work. 

[Renaissance](item_a460f234-6434-4d47-99f9-d4a0b15cd591) is, pretty objectively, the strongest option. It makes each resurrect way more impactful. Since we already picked [Crepuscular Circle](item_c0b93ed2-b692-44d5-a38a-ce5a63e83cdb), [Renaissance](item_a460f234-6434-4d47-99f9-d4a0b15cd591) can really help turn a losing team fight/neutral fight (the fight before it really begins/someone uses an ultimate), but, with how fast-paced stadium can be, resurrect takes a long time and can be extremely risky (but that depends on the map and how the enemy team plays). I would recommend getting [Resurrection Rangefinder](item_99baffec-51b5-42e4-be61-e29f3de8219f) and replacing [Amari's Antidote](item_67e0b1c5-3bcb-4ab5-b818-5082e5706124) with [Hardlight Accelerator](item_0390c8af-2a68-4da2-b876-93da32c3f448) for more cool down. 

 [Triage Unit](item_fec0554c-2685-4b93-822d-bf0020e654b4) is great for pocketing tanks/helping them. This can be especially good if you notice the enemy running tankbuster builds on Mei and Reaper, a scary enemy tank shredding your tank, or you pick up on a lot of %-based damage items like [Three-tap Tommygun](item_39c5d2a4-1db0-444f-86d9-2a1e9a331429) or [Volskaya Ordnance](item_396c0970-daa8-47e3-8049-e65f03fe5cec) (that second one is pretty unpopular, so I'm not sure if it's even good -.-). 
TLDR: good for pocketing tank, DPS and support usually get shredded too quickly for this power to matter; it's also a bit difficult to use (easier with [Angelic Acrobatics](item_baad85fc-3da5-43af-ad9d-f17885f59aa5))

 [Serenity](item_c6e1c072-ff50-467e-b59f-9506baea10c1) is helpful for survivability. Be warned!!! In my experience this power is not crazy impactful outside of Valk. Even with [Threads of Fate](item_cb61612b-9d83-49a9-989d-013bf084fbcb) and lots of healing, it's not meant to make you invincible. BUT, it does get better in the late-game with [Nebula Conduit](item_476b7040-54c9-4f0c-8283-b4407f6809f8) and  [Ogundimu Reduction Field](item_b12daf48-069b-44c1-88fe-221cbcff664d) to reduce the influx of burst damage. 

 [Battle Medic](item_ccd0edff-4d57-4ac2-83a7-bab6ff0ffb2f) actually increases your healing during Valk (only if you have [Crepuscular Circle](item_c0b93ed2-b692-44d5-a38a-ce5a63e83cdb)). I am aware that the Devs said that it doesn't, but in-game testing says different. This healing increase is somewhat noticeable, but you should really only pick this power if you plan on blastering a lot (and succeeding). It's not META, but it gives a ton of carry potential.

round_upgrades.notes: This can replace Amari's Antidote for the cool down. It's only a 3 second decrease to the cool down, so I typically don't do this unless I also get Resurrection Rangefinder.
Good on certain maps (depends on your comfort). It can be good to use this item on Temple of Anubis and Redwood Dam

Good for pocketing tanks;other roles die too quickly other than specific builds (sleep Ana and armor Mei) 
Difficult to use but pretty powerful.

notes:
Get [Hardlight Accelerator](item_0390c8af-2a68-4da2-b876-93da32c3f448) and adjust your build according to the damage incoming from the enemy team. 

 [Amari's Antidote](item_67e0b1c5-3bcb-4ab5-b818-5082e5706124) and [Booster Jets](item_a291de85-b6d9-43cf-b5da-f3184a156f48) alone should already provide a large amount of healing, so don't be afraid to part ways with them for survivability like [Angelic Acrobatics](item_baad85fc-3da5-43af-ad9d-f17885f59aa5) or utility from [Resurrection Rangefinder](item_99baffec-51b5-42e4-be61-e29f3de8219f).

round_upgrades.notes: Since Nebula Conduit reduces burst DMG into DMG over time, this item can reach max stacks easily. Just keep in mind that 10% DMG reduction isn't actually too insane compared to the DMG you can/might face
Generally not worth it unless you've truly won all the bread and become the richest Mercy in all the land (nearing ~$65K)
Very helpful for softening the hit from burst damage like Cassidy headshots or Juno torpedoes. You will still need to get healed though

notes:
For powers, [First Responder](item_30a5c70f-e0b5-489a-96ae-900f34c3823d) and [Distortion](item_5557e2f2-02df-4eac-8128-0c23b71183b1) both pair well with [Renaissance](item_a460f234-6434-4d47-99f9-d4a0b15cd591). Again, [Serenity](item_c6e1c072-ff50-467e-b59f-9506baea10c1) can help with survivability and scales well with [Nebula Conduit](item_476b7040-54c9-4f0c-8283-b4407f6809f8) (which will make it easier to take burst DMG but really only 1-2 instances at a time bcs the enemies will do a LOT of damage by round 7). 
I put in a VERY high healing build, but each item in the optional list is VERY good for survivability. In late game, a lot of Cassidy and Genji players become really problematic with a ton of burst damage which will make your healing focused build irrelevant. There's also Moira and Juno with anti-heals and slows that make Mercy worse. This is why we need survivability to enable teamfight-saving resurrects and contest/battle mercy during Valk. 

I would suggest getting rid of [Amari's Antidote](item_67e0b1c5-3bcb-4ab5-b818-5082e5706124) first in place of [Angelic Acrobatics](item_baad85fc-3da5-43af-ad9d-f17885f59aa5) if you feel that you'll be able to evade fire and pull off a lot of rezzes. Otherwise, [Nebula Conduit](item_476b7040-54c9-4f0c-8283-b4407f6809f8) will be better for slowing down the burst damage you take.

If you're not finding a lot of opportunities to Rez, try picking up [Nebula Conduit](item_476b7040-54c9-4f0c-8283-b4407f6809f8) and [Ogundimu Reduction Field](item_b12daf48-069b-44c1-88fe-221cbcff664d) for an even tanker build that can take on riskier resurrects (not too risky, I mean against roughly 200 incoming DMG)

round_upgrades.notes: I personally find this power pretty unrewarding. It can be helpful for stabilizing along with Renaissance (which will give you Valk's free flight + GA refresh)
Serenity's main upside is being extremely tanky during Valk. This pairs well with Renaissance and can also be good with other powers like Distortion & Triage Unit.

Good for pocketing tanks;other roles die too quickly other than specific builds (sleep Ana and armor Mei) 
Difficult to use but pretty powerful.
For Mercies that want to take the game into their own hands. Since it already gives a lot of AttkSpd, you might want to consider stacking more WP instead of AttkSpd in your items
Again, this is for the rich Mercies!

The passive isn't very useful. We want this item purely to stack AttkSpd. Keeping it along with an $11K cost WP item will lead to the highest healing in the least slots. It can be somewhat replaced by Advanced Nanobiotics if you have to focus on survivability

Still situational, but it does enable a lot. Rez range is typically a 5m sphere and 7m after you start Rez. With Rez range, it becomes closer to 8.75m and 12.25m (I haven't fact checked that second number so be warned)
Slows burst damage (can also replace either Hardlight Accelerator or Amari's Antidote)
